com.jcraft.jsch

Interface MAC


  • public interface MAC
    Usually not to be used by applications. A Message Authentication Code algorithm which will be used by the library to make sure the messages are not tampered with.

    This interface is a slimmed-down version of Mac.

    The library gets the implementation class from a configuration option (with the name of the algorithm as key) and then instantiates an object using the no-argument constructor. The algorithms to be used are negotiated during key exchange.

    The library includes two implementations for each of the algorithms hmac-sha1, hmac-sha1-96, hmac-md5, hmac-md5-96, one based on JCE's Mac class (available in Java SE from 1.4 on) and another one done manually (using MessageDigest). The latter ones are by default used on Mac OS X, the former ones on other systems.

    See Also:
    RFC 4253, Section 6.4, Data Integrity, RFC 2104, HMAC: Keyed-Hashing for Message Authentication, Mac

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void doFinal(byte[] buf, int offset)
      Finalizes the production of the digest, producing the digest value.
      int getBlockSize()
      The size of the produced MAC, i.e. the digest length, in bytes.

      The name of the algorithm, as defined in RFC 4253.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        String getName()
        The name of the algorithm, as defined in RFC 4253.
        Returns:
        for the build-in algorithms, one of hmac-sha1, hmac-sha1-96, hmac-md5 and hmac-md5-96.

      • getBlockSize

        int getBlockSize()
        The size of the produced MAC, i.e. the digest length, in bytes.

      • init

        void init(byte[] key)
   throws Exception
        Initializes the MAC, providing the key.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • update

        void update(byte[] foo,
            int start,
            int len)
        Updates the MAC with some data.
        Parameters:
        foo - an array containing the data to authenticate.
        start - the position in foo where the data starts.
        len - the length of the data.

      • update

        void update(int foo)
        Updates the MAC with 4 bytes of data.
        Parameters:
        foo - a 32 bit value, which will be interpreted as 4 bytes in big-endian order.

      • doFinal

        void doFinal(byte[] buf,
             int offset)
        Finalizes the production of the digest, producing the digest value.
        Parameters:
        buf - an array to put the authentication code into.
        offset - the position in buf where the output should begin.
